questions.question: Melvin is …………………………. Edwin.
questions.description: Elder cannot be used predicatively (after a verb).

questions.question: She is older ………………………….. her husband.
questions.description: Use than after older.

questions.question: She is junior ……………………….. me.
questions.description: The words junior and senior are followed by to.

questions.question: He earns more than …………………………..
questions.description: A subject pronoun is unusual after than.

questions.question: I prefer running ……………………….. jogging.
questions.description: Prefer should be followed by to.

questions.question: That was ……………………….. experience in my life.
questions.description: Worst is the superlative form of bad.

questions.question: I am older than ………………………….. is.
questions.description: We use a subject pronoun after than when the pronoun is followed by a verb.

questions.question: I prefer coffee ………………………….. tea.
He is ………………………… than I am.
questions.description: Worse is the comparative form of bad.

questions.question: Humans are ……………………………. than animals.
questions.description: The comparative form of intelligent is more intelligent.

questions.question: He is ……………………………. of the two.
My ………………………….. brother is a soldier.
questions.description: Elder and older can both be used before nouns.

questions.question: That was an incredible sight.
questions.description: That is a pronoun and sight is a noun. Incredible is the adjective modifying the noun sight.

questions.question: It was a stupid thing to do.
questions.description: Here the adjective stupid modifies the noun thing.

questions.question: She is cleverer than I thought.
questions.description: Clever indicates a quality. Words describing qualities are adjectives.

questions.question: Do you know any shop that sells coconuts?
questions.description: Here the adjective any modifies the noun shop.

questions.question: She seems to be very intelligent.
He was a mischievous boy who always landed himself in trouble.
questions.description: Here mischievous is the adjective modifying the noun boy.

questions.question: She looked gorgeous in that gown.
questions.description: Words describing qualities are all adjectives.

questions.question: This is the eighth chocolate you have eaten today.
questions.description: Both cardinal and ordinal numbers are adjectives.

questions.question: Thank you for your quick reply.
questions.description: Here the adjective quick modifies the noun reply.

questions.question: The sun is the brightest object in the sky.
It was an unforgettable experience.
The job was more difficult than I thought.
I will talk to you …………………..
questions.description: Later refers to time latter refers to position or order.

questions.question: Of the two options, the ……………………… is more viable.
questions.description: Latter is the opposite of former.

questions.question: The …………………….. chapter is very interesting.
She is ……………………… than her husband.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are not used predicatively.

questions.question: This is the ……………………….. building in the city.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are only used of people.

questions.question: Mumbai is ……………………….. from Kochi than Mangalore.
questions.description: Farther shows distance.

questions.question: How far is the ………………………. railway station from here?
questions.description: Nearest denotes distance.

questions.question: Cats are inferior ……………………….. dogs in intelligence.
questions.description: The adjectives inferior, superior, junior and senior take the preposition to, not than.

questions.question: There is ………………………….. water in the well.
questions.description: Little means hardly any or not much.

questions.question: Can you give me ……………………… water?
questions.description: A little means some.

questions.question: …………………………. knowledge is a dangerous thing.
……………………… knowledge of carpentry that he possessed proved to be helpful.
questions.description: The little means not much, but the whole of that much.

questions.question: He stayed here for ……………………… days.
questions.description: A few refers to a small number. Few means almost none.

questions.question: He is taller than ………………………… of his four brothers.
questions.description: We use all to talk about more than two.

questions.question: Hindi is …………………….. difficult than Chinese.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little.

questions.question: Sam is ……………………. than Mary.
questions.description: Elder and eldest can only be used before a noun.

questions.question: There aren’t ……………………… people who can afford to buy a yacht.
questions.description: Use many with plural nouns much with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: ……………………… money was wasted on the project.
questions.description: Use much before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: This is ……………………… book on World War II.
questions.description: Use the with superlative adjectives.

questions.question: A donkey is …………………………. than a horse.
I prefer tea ……………………… coffee.
He is …………………………of the two.
questions.description: We use the comparative form to talk of two people or things.

questions.question: We have never seen …………………….. a good boy.
questions.description: Such is used before a noun or adjective + noun.

questions.question: The children performed really …………………………
questions.description: Well is an adverb and good is an adjective.

questions.question: Of the two sisters, Susie is the ……………………..
questions.description: We do not normally use the superlative to talk about two people or things.

questions.question: Mumbai is …………………………. from Kochi than Bangalore.
questions.description: Farther shows distance.

questions.question: I want ……………………….. information.
questions.description: Further means additional.

questions.question: Namita is my …………………….. sister.
This painting is superior ……………………….. that.
questions.description: The adjectives superior, inferior, junior and senior are followed by to.

questions.question: The injured were taken to the ………………………. hospital.
questions.description: Nearest indicates distance. Next indicates order.

questions.question: As soon as she finished one project, she started working on the ………………………
You must act without any ……………………….. delay.
He is the ………………………. man in the town.
Is this the ……………………….. edition of this book?
questions.description: Latest means the most recent.

questions.question: He is the ………………………. of the two.
The meeting was attended by ………………………. parents.
questions.description: A few means some.

questions.question: The Nile is the longest river in the world.
questions.description: Here the adjective longest modifies the noun river.

questions.question: The family lives in a small hut.
questions.description: Here the adjective small modifies the noun hut.

questions.question: The rose is a beautiful flower.
questions.description: Here the adjective beautiful modifies the noun flower.

questions.question: Monday is the second day of the week.
questions.description: Here the adjective second modifies the noun day.

questions.question: The child drank some milk.
questions.description: Here the adjective some modifies the noun milk.

questions.question: It was an unforgettable experience for me.
questions.description: Here the adjective unforgettable modifies the noun experience.

questions.question: She is the most intelligent girl in the class.
questions.description: Here the adjective intelligent modifies the noun girl.

questions.question: Greenland is the largest island in the world.
questions.description: Here the adjective largest modifies the noun island.

questions.question: The poor woman leads a miserable life.
questions.description: Here adjective poor modifies the noun woman and the adjective miserable modifies the noun life.

questions.question: She is such a wonderful woman.
questions.description: Here the adjective wonderful modifies the noun woman.

questions.question: You needn’t have said those awful words to him.
questions.description: Both those and awful are adjectives modifying the noun words.

questions.question: There are lots of red flowers on the plant.
My ………………….. sister is a journalist.
questions.description: Before a noun elder and older can both be used to talk about the order of birth of the members of a family.

questions.question: He is the ………………………. member of the club.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are only used to talk of members of a family.

questions.question: She was happy when she got the job but two weeks ……………………. she was fired.
questions.description: Later means after that time.

questions.question: She could become an actor or a model – she chose the …………………….. option.
questions.description: Latter means the second of the two.

questions.question: She is still on good terms with her ……………………………. boyfriend.
questions.description: Former means the first of the two. It can also mean erstwhile.

questions.question: I cannot walk any ………………………
questions.description: Further and farther can both be used to talk about distance.

questions.question: They refused to give any ………………………….  details.
questions.description: Further can mean additional.

questions.question: There were ………………………… applicants than expected.
questions.description: We use fewer before plural nouns.

questions.question: I have ……………………………… interest in politics.
questions.description: We use the positive degree of the adjective when there is no idea of comparison.

questions.question: He earns ………………………….. money than his wife.
questions.description: Before uncountable nouns we use less.

questions.question: You didn’t eat ………………………… food.
questions.description: We use much before uncountable nouns.

questions.question: There aren’t ……………………….. apples left.
questions.description: We use many before plural nouns.

questions.question: He is ………………….. than I expected.
questions.description: Later is the comparative form of late.

questions.question: He is ……………………… than prudent.
questions.description: When we compare two descriptions, we use more.

questions.question: Janet is prettier than ……………………….. in the class.
questions.description: When two objects are compared with each other, the latter term of comparison must exclude the former.

questions.question: The ………………………. chapters are not very interesting.
questions.description: Latter is the opposite of former.

questions.question: Ours is the ………………………… house on this street.
questions.description: Last indicates position.

questions.question: Have you heard the ……………………….. news?
questions.description: Latest is used to talk about very recent things.

questions.question: She thinks her new job is much better than the ……………………. one.
questions.description: Last can mean the one before this one.

questions.question: I am enjoying my ………………………. job.
This is the ……………………. warning you get from me.
Were you at the meeting ……………………. Monday?
questions.description: The expressions last month, last week, last Monday etc. are used without articles and prepositions.

questions.question: He is much ……………………. than his wife.
questions.description: We use old, older and oldest to talk of age.

questions.question: This is the ……………………….. mosque in India.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are used only of persons, not of animals or things.

questions.question: Have you bought …………………… mangoes?
questions.description: We use any in negative or interrogative sentences.

questions.question: Will you lend me ……………………. money?
questions.description: Some can be used in questions that express a command or request.

questions.question: ……………………… seat was taken.
questions.description: We use a singular noun after every.

questions.question: Five students are seated on ……………………..
questions.description: We use each before a singular noun.

questions.question: He visits us …………………….. three days.
questions.description: Every can be used before plural nouns that refer to intervals.

questions.question: He is not likely to recover. That means there is ………………….. hope of his recovery.
questions.description: Little means not much.

questions.question: He showed ……………………….. concern for me.
questions.description: Little means not much.

questions.question: ……………………… tact would have saved the situation.
questions.description: A little means 'some though not much'.

questions.question: ………………………… knowledge is a dangerous thing.
questions.description: A little means 'some though not much'.

questions.question: …………………….. grain we had was damaged in the rains.
questions.description: The little means not much but all that is there.

questions.question: ……………………… people are so hopeless as drunkards.
questions.description: Few means hardly any.

questions.question: ………………………. remarks that he made were very poignant.
He is ………………… than his neighbors.
The brides were much ……………… than the grooms.
He is too ………………… to be taught.
He is ………………… than I thought him to be.
When the old woman became …………………, she began to move about.
He is much ………………… now.
The offer was too ………………… to be true.
He fishes with ………………… success than I do.
Shakespeare is the ………………… playwright in English.
The pain was ………………… than he could bear.
The ………………… thing of all was that his son was rude to him.
Jane was the ………………… player of the two.
The car suffered heavy damage.
Every dog has his day.
I have bought enough sugar.
She was wearing a blue gown.
I have had my fair share of disappointments.
The way was long and the wind was cold.
Don’t cry over spilt milk.
He won the first prize.
He is a man of few words.
He died a glorious death.
A small leak can sink a great ship.
King Francis was a hearty king and loved a royal sport.
The elephant is a large animal. The rabbit is a ................................. animal.
It is cold in winter. It is ....................................... in summer.
Yesterday it was cloudy. Today is a ................................. day.
These shirts are wet. Haven’t you got a ....................................... one?
We won’t reach there in time if we go by a slow train. We must catch a .................................... train.
My shoes are old. I want to buy a .................................. pair.
Some colors are bright. Others are ...................................
This bread is stale. We must buy a ................................ loaf.
This knife is blunt. I need a .................................. one.
